wikipedia_page.main: Harry Field (birth unknown – death unknown), also known by the nickname of "Tupper", was a professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1920s and 1930s. He played at representative level for Great Britain and Yorkshire, and at club level for Nostell Welfare ARLFC [1], Wakefield Trinity (Heritage № 335), and York, as a prop, or hooker, i.e. number 8 or 10, or 9, during the era of contested scrums.

response: * Harry Field won caps for Great Britain while at York in 1936 Australia, New Zealand (2 matches)

link_mentions.page: List of Great Britain national rugby league team players

response: *Harry Field (rugby league) (before 1910–after 1972), English prop or hooker during 1920s and 1930s
*Harry Field (American football) (1911–1964), American offensive tackle during 1930s
